primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from human attempts to control death (looking for life among the dead) to the reception of life as a gift from the transcendent Risen Lord.

tekstueel_bewijs: Christ has entered death and returned triumphant.
The Lord giveth, and the Lord taketh away.

object.identificatie: True and eternal life / Victory over death
tekstueel_bewijs: the source of the only true and eternal life
victory through Jesus Christ our Lord

zender.identificatie: The Transcendent God (beyond this world order)
tekstueel_bewijs: it comes from another sphere of reality
One who comes from beyond this world order altogether
those whose only claim to him is that of trust

helper.identificatie: Scriptural witness / Word and Sacraments / The Holy Spirit (implied)
tekstueel_bewijs: Only the scriptural witness... can tell us the truth
made present in the Word and the Sacraments
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who acts through these means.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through the 'pure gift' of faith.

tegenstander.identificatie: Death / The 'Death Industry' / Human Illusion of Control
tekstueel_bewijs: Death is ugly, bald, miserable... the last Enemy
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is treated as an ontological enemy that 'cannot be fixed' by human effort, requiring a transcendent intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to 'fix' death or find life in earthly things (cosmetic surgery, politics, funeral industry).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Human Race / 'We'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is exposed as a 'failed program' that serves as the negative backdrop for the primary program of Grace.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Risen Lord → Victory over the Grave

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We search the New Testament in vain.
We continue to seek for new life in all the wrong places.
We are looking for life, but we are investing in death.

voorbeelden: This should cause the whole Christian community to rise up.
Why do you seek the living among the dead?
Only the scriptural witness... can tell us the truth.
Everything can be fixed except death.
Faith... is re-empowering precisely in the midst of powerlessness.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'pouvoir' (power) over death and the 'pouvoir' of God to overcome it.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (earthly seeking) to ~S2 (denial/control) to S2 (the reality of death) and finally to S1 (Resurrection).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found only in S1, which is a 'pure gift' from outside the system.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is 'ugly' and 'cannot be fixed'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It systematically deconstructs human agency (Subject) in the face of death and replaces it with the agency of the Risen Christ.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: This should cause the whole Christian community to rise up in outrage.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the sole actor in Resurrection
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: No one saw it... God intended it that way.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Faith as a gift, not a work
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Faith in the Resurrection comes to us as a pure gift.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Peter, Mary) are shown as failing or confused, not as models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The women at the tomb are receivers of the news, not heroes of the story.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief through the surrender of control; 're-empowerment' through faith.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from human powerlessness to divine power is the consistent thread.
spanning_punten: The social justice section (NRA, prisons) feels slightly disconnected from the primary actantial movement of the Resurrection.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The King of heaven... o'er death and hell rose triumphing.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon speaks of 'Faith' as the gift, which is the Spirit's work of giving 'Pouvoir'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Death is the 'last Enemy' and a 'pitiless advance'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Pouvoir (Powerlessness vs Power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The move from 'Having to' to 'Being able' through Christ is well executed.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: A strong opponent necessitates a strong Savior.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Resurrection) clearly precedes and enables the secondary program (Ethics/Coping).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It avoids the trap of turning the Resurrection into a 'lesson for living' and keeps it as a 'mighty act of God'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the humor and anecdotes, Greimasian analysis shows these anecdotes serve to illustrate the 'failed subject' of human effort.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Lucan text; this analysis shows how the preacher uses the text to construct a specific actantial movement from death to life.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Death Industry' is not just a topic, but the 'Opponent' in the narrative structure.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's principle perfectly: Man is the subject of seeking/failing, God is the subject of acting/saving.
